summary: The Quad Space Act (S. 1946) mandates the Secretary of Defense initiate discussions with Australia, India, and Japan (the Quad) to identify mutual interests in space. This includes formulating best practices, cooperation on space situational awareness, and space industrial policy. The Secretary must report to the Armed Services Committees within 270 days, detailing potential areas of cooperation and steps to formalize Quad cooperation. The bill emphasizes the importance of the Quad in addressing Indo-Pacific security challenges and promoting a free and open region.
